comments:
The org.eclipse.hyades.execution plugin fails to startup if the workbench install contains spaces.  This prevents a myriad of TPTP functionality from working (even if you're not trying to use the IAC.)  This can be tracked to the following stack trace:

Root exception:
java.lang.NullPointerException
at java.util.Hashtable.put(Hashtable.java:630)
at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.agentcontroller.internal.config.AgentControllerEnvironment.addVariable(AgentControllerEnvironment.java:48)
at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.agentcontroller.internal.impl.FileConfigurationImpl.initializeGlobalVariables(FileConfigurationImpl.java:107)
at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.agentcontroller.internal.impl.FileConfigurationImpl.<init>(FileConfigurationImpl.java:68)

Further investigation (adding some e.printStackTrace() calls to some empty exception handlers) leads to the following root cause:

java.net.URISyntaxException: Illegal character in path at index 26: file:/C:/TPTP_TestPass/4.3 i2 testpass1/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.hyades.execution.win32.x86_4.2.0.v200606131519/
	at java.net.URI$Parser.fail(URI.java:2821)
	at java.net.URI$Parser.checkChars(URI.java:2994)
	at java.net.URI$Parser.parseHierarchical(URI.java:3078)
	at java.net.URI$Parser.parse(URI.java:3026)
	at java.net.URI.<init>(URI.java:590)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.agentcontroller.internal.impl.EclipseUtility.toURI(EclipseUtility.java:394)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.agentcontroller.internal.impl.EclipseUtility.getBundleInstallLocation(EclipseUtility.java:165)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.agentcontroller.internal.impl.EclipseUtility.getFragmentInstallLocations(EclipseUtility.java:316)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.agentcontroller.internal.impl.EclipseUtility.getFragmentInstallLocations(EclipseUtility.java:337)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.agentcontroller.internal.impl.FileConfigurationImpl.initializeGlobalVariables(FileConfigurationImpl.java:104)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.agentcontroller.internal.impl.FileConfigurationImpl.<init>(FileConfigurationImpl.java:68)
Target to 4.3 w/o iteration - awaiting triage.
Just for clarification, I'm seeing this on Windows XP SP2 as well.

Thanks for the catch George -- I didn't see it on Vista either -- I must have fat-fingered the entry below XP when selecting the OS.

As far as I know, this happens on all supported windows flavors, and should definitely block the release of 4.3 (although not necessarily block the completion of testpass 2, as there is a simple workaround.)

Mark this as a dup to bug 161276.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 161276 ***
